You stand on the forecastle, gazing out at clear skies and gentle seas. 

The chattering of your crew darkens, adopting an ominous tone. Gathered at the starboard railing, they peer out at the sea.
"Grab your spears and prepare for a hunt!"
"We'll let the creature pass in peace."

It hauls the skiff in a wide circle around the ship, knocking against the hull and nearly yanking [Specified 3]'s arm from the socket. 

Still, you feel the creature's strength beginning to wane.

Several hours later, [Specified 1] deems it safe to leap aboard the beast. With a few swift swings of a hatchet, the sailor severs the beast's spinal cord.

Yet the magnificent creature continues alongside your ship for many hours. A low, mournful music rises above the light percussion of the waves, and a gentle peace envelops your crew. 

When night falls, the beast is beside you still, a comforting light in the darkness. 

By morning, it is gone, but the sense of calm it brought remains.

"Giants of the deep," [Specified 0] says. "Huana say they live at the bottom of the sea, where they can be near the heart of the world, and surface only once in a great while. It is considered rare luck to see one."

A long, pale creature breaks the surface of the water. Its skin is translucent and freckled with phosphorescence, and you can make out the ghostly outlines of luminous organs beneath it. The creature rolls slowly, staring back at you with a glowing blue eye. The nerve behind it is as thick as a halyard.

[Specified 0] smiles. "This one is young still."

[Specified 1] leans over the railing. "Plenty of meat on the beast. A prize like that could feed us for days. With the captain's permission." [Specified 1] smiles hopefully. 

Others murmur eager assent.

[Specified 2] grins fiercely. "A quarry worthy of the Lord of the Hunt. Let's have some excitement, captain!"

Nodding, [Specified 1] smiles.
[Specified 0] steps back, appalled. "You'd kill one of Ondra's harbingers? And squander this blessing?"

Harpoon in hand, [Specified 2] leaps from the skiff, using the downward momentum to drive the weapon into the beast's flesh. The creature thrashes, its tail slapping [Specified 2] from its back and into the water.

The line from the harpoon to the skiff goes taut as the whale drags the skiff along.

"It's diving!" [Specified 3] cries. 

Hatchet held high, [Specified 1] leaps forward as the whale pulls the bow of the skiff underwater.

The magnificent creature soon returns to the depths.

[Specified 0] watches it go with dismay. "So soon, and without a song? This is an ill omen, indeed."

The crew mutter quietly.
[Identify it.]
"What in Wael's name is that?"
"Ready cannons to fire! All hands to battle stations!"
"Turn us away and get us out of here!"

The choppy seas stretch towards the horizon, curls of dark blue capped with lines of foamy white.

"Captain!" shouts [Specified 3] from the rigging. "There's something in the water to port!"

The ship crests a high wave before plunging into the next trough, shuddering down its length. Clinging to the rail, [Specified 0] shouts orders from the aftcastle as water rushes across the deck.

[Specified 3] points into the rough sea. "Something ahead in the water!"
You recognize the tell-tale luminescence of a Resplendent Phantom. These large whales have been heavily hunted for meat throughout the Deadfire.
There's only one breed of glowing sea life of this size to your knowledge - the Resplendent Phantom. Their sweet flesh makes them a popular quarry among whale hunters.

"A Resplendent Phantom! We could not ask for a fairer omen than this beauty!"

TekÄ“hu's cups his hands and lets out a deep, musical call that carries across the waves. The whale answers with a majestic spray of water.
[Specified 5] watches the growing glow. "Must be a Resplendent Phantom. Big glowing whale. Good eating, or so they say."
Whatever it is, it's incredibly large and glowing like a lantern.
"No idea," [Specified 5] says. "But here it comes..."

"By the gods," [Specified 1] mutters.

The surface of the sea swells. An enormous, glowing shape is surfacing.
"Wait, captain..." [Specified 1] says, looking to [Specified 0]. "Is that what I think it is?"
"Thoughts, crew?"
[Reach out to the beast's mind.]

You open yourself to the creature's thoughts, and feel the potent pulse of its soul tingling at the edge of your own consciousness.

It feels particularly intricate, its mind almost as complex as a kith's.
You think you hear a song within its soul, a primal dirge from before the age of words.

The thoughts swirling within feel more complex than you expected of a beast, with none of the blank coldness you have sensed from fish. Its mind is not as advanced as a wilder, but the creature certainly boasts more intelligence than a horse or cow.
[Specified 2] sighs as the crew members resume their duties. You sail on.
[Specified 2] whoops happily as [Specified 1] snaps out a salute. The crew rush to lower the skiff. Their oars churn the water.

Your crew ropes up the beast and lashes it to the side of the ship. They strip rich, fatty meat from its corpse and prepare it for storage. 

That evening, you share one of the finest meals you've ever enjoyed - the beast's meat is surprisingly tender and sweet.

The front of the skiff breaks the surface, throwing [Specified 3] sharply against the gunwale, as [Specified 1] holds the end of the severed line.

The beast's glow fades away as it returns to the depths from which it came.

Off of the portside rail you see a dark shadow rising from the depths. The water splits around a hump of thick, mottled skin. 

With a sound like a horn blown underwater, two powerful jets of spray erupt from the creature's back.
[Identify it.]
"Thoughts, crew?"
[Reach out to the beast's mind.]
"Grab your spears and prepare for a hunt!"
"We'll let the creature pass in peace."
The thick, rounded head suggests a baleen whale of some kind, likely a bowhead.
[Specified 5] frowns down at the water. "Bowhead, maybe? Or a wallface. Whale either way."
It's a whale... you think.
"No idea," [Specified 5] says. "But here it comes..."

Tongue flicking across chapped lips, [Specified 2] says, "That's a wallface, captain. Best whale for hunting in the whole Deadfire."

[Specified 1] snorts. "More likely a bowhead. You see that v-shaped spout? It's on account of it having two blowholes."

[Specified 2] scoffs. "That doesn't make it any worse hunting."

"It does if it dives and sinks our skiff!" [Specified 1]'s eyes roll.
[Specified 0] steps back, appalled. "You'd kill one of Ondra's harbingers? And squander this blessing?"
[Specified 2] whoops happily as [Specified 1] snaps out a salute. The crew rush to lower the skiff. Their oars churn the water.

Harpoon in hand, [Specified 2] leaps from the skiff, using the downward momentum to drive the weapon into the beast's flesh. The creature thrashes, its tail slapping [Specified 2] from its back and into the water.

The line from the harpoon to the skiff goes taut as the whale drags the skiff along.

It hauls the skiff in a wide circle around the ship, knocking against the hull and nearly yanking [Specified 3]'s arm from the socket. 

Still, you feel the creature's strength beginning to wane.

Several hours later, [Specified 1] deems it safe to leap aboard the beast. With a few swift swings of a hatchet, the sailor severs the beast's spinal cord.

With shocking speed, the whale dives, eliciting a clipped "Shit!" from [Specified 1].

The skiff vanishes beneath the waves along with all hands.

Your crew tie off lines across the beast and loop them over the ship's rails. They swarm the carcass, stripping meat and draining oils. 

They sing a whaling shanty as they perform the bloody work.

[Specified 0] frowns at them from the aftcastle.
[Specified 2] sighs as the crew members resume their duties. You sail on.

After a few tense seconds, the crew bob back to the surface, sputtering and swearing. Frowning, [Specified 0] throws a rope down to the hands.

As the ship sets sail, [Specified 1] glances around. "Has anyone seen [Specified 3]?"

No one has.

The great beast keeps pace with the ship for several hours, its song seeming to vibrate within the very planks of [Player Ship]. [Specified 0] hums quietly along, as [Specified 2] tosses bits of food to the creature.

[Specified 1] sighs. "They don't eat hardtack."

[Specified 3] chuckles.

The ship sails on.

A massive, pale gray form appears briefly in the water ahead of you, disappearing with a flash of a flat-finned tail.

"What in Ondra's name was that?" [Specified 0] shouts.
[Identify it.]
"Ready cannons to fire! All hands to battle stations!"
"Grab your spears and prepare for a hunt!"
"We'll let the creature pass in peace."
"Turn us away and get us out of here!"
[Specified 0] nods and begins shouting orders. Hands scurry across the deck, disappearing into the hold, and the sounds of metal against metal rise from below.
"We're out of cannonballs, captain!" [Specified 0] shouts.

As it crests again, you make out three tusks jutting directly out in front of the beast like a trio of sharpened spears. 

A qilutaalik, a large carnivorous whale known for punching holes through the sides of ships.

[Specified 5] swears. "A qilutaalik! See the horns?"

You've heard of such beasts, large carnivorous whales known to punch holes through the sides of ships.
It's a whale... you think.
"No idea," [Specified 5] says. "But it looks angry..."

[Specified 0] gapes. "Gods, captain, do you jest?"

[Specified 2], though, grabs a harpoon. "I'm claiming one of those tusks for sure!"

The skiff hits the water and the crew bounce about, tossed by the water.

The crew's oars churn the sea as they close on the qilutaalik.

Harpoon in hand, [Specified 2] leaps from the skiff, using the downward momentum to drive the weapon into the beast's flesh. The creature thrashes, its tail slapping [Specified 2] from its back and into the water.

The line from the harpoon to the skiff goes taut as the whale drags the skiff along.

Harpoon in hand, [Specified 2] leaps from the skiff...

The beast twists, jaws snapping. Only the top half of [Specified 2]'s body hits the water.

"Sweet Ondra," [Specified 0] mutters as the beast rips the skiff apart.
"Aye, captain!" [Specified 0] shouts orders to [Specified 4] at the helm and the hands in the rigging. The crew scurry across the deck at the commands.
[Specified 0] balks. "With no one seasoned at the helm? Magran's flame!" The mate begins shouting orders, and the crew scurries across the deck.

[Specified 4] stares ahead, eyes narrowed and knuckles bloodless from the grip they keep on the wheel. A sound like a blade running down a shield issues from the starboard hull, and the great gray beast erupts from the sea, its three tusks stabbing at the sails as it bellows.

It crashes again into the water, rocking the boat and sending [Specified 4] sprawling. The helmsman does not get back up.

The ship begins to come about, but with nothing like enough speed, and [Player Ship] shudders as the beast strikes it from below. Somewhere below planks splinter, and hands rush towards the hatches, grabbing tools as they go.

[Specified 3]'s eyes meet yours. "I'm not sure that's an option, captain."

As if on cue, the beast explodes from among the waves, its three massive tusks stabbing forward as it slams into the side of the ship. The higher tusk tears into the rigging and main sail, while the thicker, lower tusks rip through the side of the ship and juts from the deck.
[SkillCheck 0] only barely manages to avoid being impaled by one of the protruding tusks.
One of them catches [SkillCheck 0] in the leg, and your companion drops, screaming in agony and cradling the wounded limb.
"Fire the cannons!"
"Attack it while it's stuck in the hull!"
[Throw an explosive at it.]
[Try to calm its rage.]
[Blast the creature with magic.]

You call on the spirits and channel their essence before reaching out to touch the mind of this beast.

You find it, the raging ball of aggression and hunger, and carefully unknot it, soothing the beast's anger.
Chanting with a single hand upraised towards the beast, [Specified 5] calls upon the spirits.

[Specified 1] strides forward, blade in hand, and leaps onto the thrashing beast. The mariner clings to the upper tusk while stabbing the weapon time and time again into the whale's head. 

With a crack like thunder, [Specified 0] empties an arquebus directly into the beast's eye.

The creature finally stills.
You take stock of what you have available...
[Throw a grenade.]
[Throw an immolator.]
[Throw a blister bomb.]
[Throw a lightning bomb.]
You hurl bolts of magic at the beast, scoring its flesh, but it continues to thrash, tearing apart the deck with its tusks, biting into the hull with its toothed maw, angrier than ever.
[Specified 5] hurls bolts of magic at the beast, scoring its flesh, but it continues to thrash, tearing apart the deck with its tusks, biting into the hull with its toothed maw, angrier than ever.
The ship rocks as the cannons erupt below, blowing holes through the beast and sending up plumes of red mist.
The ship rocks with the volley of the cannons, but none of them hit their mark. The beast thrashes, tearing through the hull.
A sound like thunder rends the air, and the deck comes apart beneath your feet. For an impossibly long moment the world spins around you, and then you plunge into the water.

You hang in the water, stunned, pieces of lumber and steel sinking around you. Too weak to swim, you watch the surface recede.

Darkness claims you.

The whale's tusks remain lodged in the ship, and its blood slickens the deck, but calm again falls over [Player Ship]. 

The crew gather, quietly clapping one another on the back, before they begin harvesting the beast.

The creature stills, and you peer into its large, black eyes. You see understanding there.

The whale wriggles free of the hull, sliding back into the water. Calm reigns again aboard the deck.
[Do something else.]
The beast thrashes. You are running out of time. And options.
You hurl the explosive directly into the beast's blow hole...
[Specified 5] hurls the explosive directly into the beast's blow hole...

The explosive wedges between the beast and the deck, in dangerous contact with the ship...

"Are you insane?!" cries [Specified 0].

It explodes.
The beast's back erupts in a cataclysmic blast of blood and viscera.
Flames erupt from the screeching beast, burning away its flesh and singeing your own eyebrows.
The beast screams as the corrosive bomb bursts in its back, pouring its deadly payload directly into its lungs.
Electricity arcs bluish white across the beast's back, leaping up to the mast and down to the surface of the water.

[Specified 1] whispers a quiet prayer, as [Specified 0] claps you on the back. [Specified 3] stares out at the sea.

Even the waters feel quieted. For now.

But the beast ignores the sailor, swimming straight at [Player Ship]. It slams into the side of the ship, sending [Specified 2] crashing into the side of the hull. The sailor falls limply into the water. 

The whale's higher tusk tears into the rigging and main sail, while the thicker, lower tusks rip through the side of the ship and jut from the deck.
[Specified 0] steps back, appalled. "You'd slay one of Ngati's children? And squander this blessing?"
[Specified 0] steps back, appalled. "You'd slay one of Ngati's children? And squander this blessing?"
"Let it go!"
[Say nothing.]
If the whale dives, they're in trouble.
[Specified 1] swears, but cuts the harpoon line.
With a final blast from its blowholes, the beast slips beneath the water, leaving you on the churning sea.
Rekke stares at you blankly. After a few long, silent moments, his eyes widen, and he slowly shakes his head.
